description: This course surveys standard algorithms and data structures with emphasis on implementation
experience and complexity analysis.  Topics include algorithmic strategies, fundamental
computer algorithms, stacks, queues, lists, trees, hash tables, heaps and priority queues,
compression, and decompression.  Prerequisites: MATH 282 (MATH 244 or MATH 252) and
CSCI 251, or consent of the instructor. Offered annually. Counts toward neuroscience concentration.
